p: In 2015, about 71 million people lived with HCV infection; in 2017, 19% (13.1 million) of them knew their infection status and only 15% (2 million) of people already diagnosed with HCV infection received curative treatment in the same year. Overall, between 2014 and 2017, 5 million people received HCV infection eradication treatment, but in the same year, 1.75 million people had recently developed a chronic HCV infection [ 5].
